page.title: 04ENGLISH CHINA CLAY (cont)
page.content: {THE PORT OF PAR} It is no good producing the clay if it cannot be transported easily to where it will be needed. For this purpose the ports of Par and Fowey are used. The port of Par was built around 130 years ago (in the 1830's) by a man named J.T. Treffry. It is a completely man-made port and was originally built to serve the local copper and tin mining industries. In 1964 E.C.C. bought the port of Par, although they had been using it to transport their clay since 1946. It is the main port for the export of clay by sea.
